description: A spell used to open doors; it is probably related to Alohamora.

The Summoning Charm (Accio) allows the caster to summon objects toward themselves, either in direct line of sight or out of view, by calling the object's name aloud after the incantation (unless cast nonverbally). Successful casting requires the caster to have a clear mental image of the object. The charm's opposite is the Banishing Charm.
pronunciation: Various, including: AK-ee-oh, AK-see-oh, AS-see-oh (US), and AT-chee-oh (Anglo-Catholic pronunciation)
effect: Summons an object from a distance
origin: The Latin word accio means "I call" or "I summon".
notes: The Summoning Charm could not be used on buildings. In addition, it did not work on most living things, and those few on which it did were generally not considered worth Summoning, such as flobberworms.

description: Produces a clean, drinkable jet of water from the wand tip.
origin: Derived from Latin 'aqua' meaning 'water' and 'menti', likely referring to 'mind'.
notes: This spell can be used to extinguish fires, hydrate people, or fill containers with water.

description: Unlocks objects such as doors and windows.
effect: Unlocks locks on doors or windows
origin: From the West African Sidiki dialect meaning 'friendly to thieves'.

description: Clears someone's airway if they are choking.
Reveals hidden or invisible messages, particularly those written in invisible ink.
notes: Often used to read hidden or enchanted texts.

description: Allows a witch or wizard to teleport instantly to another location. Disapparating is the opposite.
effect: Transports the caster instantly to another place
notes: Requires a license and is risky if performed improperly.

description: Lifts the caster high into the air. The charm also works underwater, propelling the caster above the surface.
notes: Useful for escaping from underwater or low places.

description: Transforms the target's bogeys into large bats that fly out of the victim's nose. It was invented by Miranda Goshawk.
effect: Transformed target's bogeys into bats that flew out of the victim's nose

description: The exact effects of the spell are unknown, though it presumably is of damaging nature and it produces a bolt of white light from the tip of the wand.
Transforms the target's bogeys into large bats that fly out of the victim's nose. It was invented by Miranda Goshawk.
